definition: ordinary/commonplace/mundane/temporal/of the material world (as opposed to supernatural or immortal levels)/every/all/whatever/altogether/gist/outline/note of Chinese musical scale
variant of 盈餘|盈余[ying2 yu2]
to win without needing to even lift a finger/victory presented on a platter
profitable to both sides/a win-win situation

sentences.english: NIKOLAY DAVYDENKO: Shock, maybe just for press shocked, because Nadal always winning here.
sentences.chinese: 很雷，但是是壓迫的雷，因爲納達爾在這兒總能贏。

sentences.english: Through the mechanism of state-owned enterprises reform, gradually reducing losses for the win.
sentences.chinese: 通過對國有企業機制的改革，逐步走向扭虧爲贏。

sentences.english: OK, let do it. We three will surely win.
sentences.chinese: 行，就這樣辦，我們三個人肯定贏。

sentences.english: I could have won, but I goofed up.
And even the most Clinton-leaning prognosticators allowed for some chance of a Trump win.
sentences.chinese: 即使最挺希拉里的預測家都認可川普有些機會贏。

sentences.english: WWIII. A war we cannot win.
sentences.chinese: 這是一場我們贏不了的戰爭。

sentences.english: Occasionally, at least, Harris and Lopez should carry them to a victory.
sentences.chinese: 至少，哈里斯和洛佩茲應該偶爾率隊贏下場比賽。

sentences.english: I hope that he will win the game.
sentences.chinese: 莪剘望咃噲贏嘚這場笓賽。

sentences.english: High card is the lowest possible winning hand combination.
sentences.chinese: 憑高牌取勝是在所有贏手裏可能性最小的。

sentences.english: It's nice to play well and it's nice to win the big games.
sentences.chinese: 打得好當然高興，贏比賽更高興。

sentences.english: A feisty girl always wins arguments.
sentences.chinese: 一個好拚鬥的女孩子時常贏爭吵。

sentences.english: When you buy a put, you win only if the market falls fast enough.
sentences.chinese: 如果你買入看跌期權，只有市場跌的足夠快你才能贏。

sentences.english: For the Lakers, it was their first win against a lesser team.
sentences.chinese: 對湖人來說，這是他們第一次贏弱隊。

sentences.english: Somebody hit on a machine but it wasn't any heavy hit.
sentences.chinese: 有人玩喫角子機贏了，可沒有贏多少。

sentences.english: Open open teaching time, let your child win on the starting line.
sentences.chinese: 開啓智教時期，讓孩子贏正在起跑線。

definition: to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
to defeat/to overpower/to beat/to be defeated
to fit one into the other/to bring two things into contact

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
